intro: Calyptrella micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered calyptrella, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
